content: The Act is titled the "Officer Daniel Faulkner Children of Fallen Heroes Scholarship Act of 2010" and outlines the calculation of eligibility. Section 473(b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include eligibility criteria for students whose parent or guardian died in military service in Iraq or Afghanistan after September 11, 2001. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include eligibility criteria for students whose parent or guardian died in military service in Iraq or Afghanistan after September 11, 2001. The amendment also addresses students whose parent died in the line of duty as a public safety officer. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include eligibility criteria for students affected by the death of a parent or guardian in military service or as a public safety officer. Financial aid administrators are required to verify eligibility, adjust family contributions, and notify the Secretary of adjustments. Additionally, students receiving increased Federal Pell Grant amounts are subject to specific treatment. Students receiving increased Federal Pell Grants are not considered in calculating educational assistance benefits under the Public Safety Officers' Benefits program. Definitions for "firefighter" and "law enforcement officer" are provided. The curr_chunk defines terms related to public safety officers, including those involved in prevention, detection, investigation, or prosecution of violations of law, and members of rescue squads or ambulance crews. The term "Federal or public agency" is also clarified. The curr_chunk defines the term 'public safety officer' as an individual serving a Federal or public agency in an official capacity as a law enforcement officer. It includes individuals from various entities such as the Amtrak Police department or Federal Reserve Police department. The term 'public safety officer' refers to individuals serving in official capacities without compensation, such as law enforcement officers, firefighters, or members of rescue squads or ambulance crews. The Pell Grant amount is calculated. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust Pell Grant amounts for eligible students meeting specific requirements. The increase calculated under paragraph (8)(B) for that year is provided to students only if funds are specifically appropriated in advance for that award year. Students are not eligible for other amounts available under paragraph (8)(A). The Budgetary Effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Act and its amendments will take effect on July 1, 2011.
